ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: At the moment I am thinking about my feelings
At the moment I am thinking about my problems
At the moment I am thinking about upsetting memories
At the moment I am thinking about negative future situations
How long have you been thinking about these topics up to this moment?
How much do you feel weighed down by these thoughts at this moment?
The same thoughts keep going through my mind again and again
Thoughts come to my mind without me wanting them to
I get stuck on certain issues and cannot move on
In the past 15 minutes, I have been thinking about my feelings
In the past 15 minutes, I have been thinking about my problems
In the past 15 minutes, I felt weighed down by these thoughts
In the past 15 minutes, I got stuck on certain issues and could not move on
Timepoint/visit label
Which survey collected the EMA data?
Notes: e.g., Morning report; Random; First Drink; Bedtime; Drinking Follow-up; Drinking Follow-up 2; Drinking Follow-up 3; Breathalyzer Test

ElementDescription: Day of the EMA collection
Day of the week for the EMA collection
Notes: 1= Sunday; 2= Monday; 3= Tuesday; 4= Wednesday; 5= Thursday; 6= Friday; 7= Saturday

ElementDescription: Date and time of EMA collection
